pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:0.4: The training rule on indecent speech
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.2: At that time Venerable Udāyī was staying in the wilderness,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.4: On one occasion a number of women came to the monastery to see the dwellings.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.7: “Venerable, we would like to see your dwelling.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.8: Then, after showing them his own dwelling, he praised and disparaged their private parts; he requested and implored, asked and enquired, described, instructed, and abused.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.9: Those women among them who were shameless scoundrels flirted with Udāyī; they called out to him, laughed with him, and made fun of him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.10: But, after leaving, those among them who had a sense of shame complained to the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.12: We wouldn’t want to hear this from our own husbands, let alone from Venerable Udāyī.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.1: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.2: “How can Venerable Udāyī speak indecently to women?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.3: They rebuked Udāyī in many ways and told the Buddha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.4: The Buddha had the Sangha assembled and questioned Udāyī:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.5: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you spoke indecently to women?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.8: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it should not to be done.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.9: How can you speak indecently to women?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.10: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of passion …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.11: for the stilling of the fevers of sense desire?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.12: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.13: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.14: ‘If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, speaks indecent words connected with sexual intercourse to a woman, as a young man might to a young woman, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.6: having lust, longing for, in love with.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.8: A desiring mind is distorted; an angry mind is distorted; a deluded mind is distorted.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.9: But in this case “distorted” refers to the desiring mind.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.11: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal. She understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is decent and what is indecent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.13: speech connected with the anus, the vagina, or sexual intercourse.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.16: As a young man might to a young woman:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.17: a male youth to a female youth, a boy to a girl, a male who indulges in sensual pleasures to a female who indulges in sensual pleasures.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.20: He commits an offense entailing suspension:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.21: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.1: Referring to the anus or the vagina, he praises, disparages, requests, implores, asks, enquires, describes, instructs, abuses.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.3: extols, praises, commends the two private orifices.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.5: despises, reviles, censures the the anus or the vagina.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.7: saying, “Give to me; you should to give to me.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.9: saying, “When will you please your mother?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.12: “When will there be a good opportunity, a good time, a good moment?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.13: “When will I have sexual intercourse with you?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.15: saying, “How do you give to your husband?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.16: “How do you give to your lover?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.18: saying, “So you give to your husband like this,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.19: and to your lover like this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.21: having been asked, he says, “Give like this. When you do, you’ll be dear and pleasing to your husband.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.23: not having been asked, he says, “Give like this. When you do, you’ll be dear and pleasing to your husband.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.1^b: Referring to private parts of a single woman, etc.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.1: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.2: If the monk, referring to the anus or the vagina of the woman, praises, disparages, requests, implores, asks, enquires, describes, instructs, abuses, he commits an offense entailing suspension. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.4^a: Referring to private parts of two beings of the same kind
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.4: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.5: If the monk, referring to the anus or the vagina of both women, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.6: abuses, he commits two offenses entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.8^a: Referring to private parts of two beings of a different kind
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.8: It is a woman and a eunuch, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.9: If the monk, referring to the anus or the vagina of both of them, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.10: abuses, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.1^a: Referring to other parts of the body: below the collar bone and above the knees
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.1: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.2: If the monk, referring to any part of the woman below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.3: abuses, he commits a serious offense. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.4: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.5: If the monk, referring to any part of both women below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.6: abuses, he commits two serious offenses. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.7: It is a woman and a eunuch, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.8: If the monk, referring to any part of both of them below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.9: abuses, he commits one serious offense and one offense of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.1^a: Referring to other parts of the body: above the collar bone or below the knees
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.1: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.2: If the monk, referring to any part of the woman above the collar bone or below the knees, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.3: abuses, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.4: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.5: If the monk, referring to any part of both women above the collar bone or below the knees, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.6: abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.7: It is a woman and a eunuch, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.8: If the monk, referring to any part of both of them above the collar bone or below the knees, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.9: abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.1^a: Referring to anything connected to the body
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.1: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.2: If the monk, referring to anything connected to the woman’s body, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.3: abuses, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.4: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.5: If the monk, referring to anything connected to the body of both women, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.6: abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.7: It is a woman and a eunuch, but he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.8: If the monk, referring to anything connected to the body of both of them, praises, disparages …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.9: abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.2: if he is aiming at what is beneficial;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.3: if he is aiming at giving a teaching;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.4: if he is aiming at giving instruction;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.6: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.10: I hope the path has an end,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.11: Faith, with a gift, with work.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.1: At one time a certain woman was wearing a newly dyed woolen cloak.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.2: A lustful monk said to her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.4: She did not understand and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.5: “Yes, Venerable, it’s a newly dyed woolen cloak.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.6: He became anxious and thought, “The Buddha has laid down a training rule. Could it be that I’ve committed an offense entailing suspension?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.7: He told the Buddha, who  said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.9: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.1: At one time a certain woman was wearing a cloak of coarse wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.2: A lustful monk said to her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.4: She did not understand and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.5: “Yes, Venerable, it’s a cloak of coarse wool.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.8: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.1: At one time a certain woman was wearing a newly woven cloak of wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.2: A lustful monk said to her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.4: She did not understand and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.5: “Yes, Venerable, it’s a newly woven cloak of wool.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.8: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.1: At one time a certain woman was wearing a cloak of coarse wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.2: A lustful monk said to her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.4: She did not understand and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.5: “Yes, Venerable, it’s a cloak of coarse wool.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.8: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.1: At one time a certain woman was wearing a fleecy upper robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.2: A lustful monk said to her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.4: She did not understand and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.5: “Yes, Venerable, it’s a fleecy upper robe.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.8: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.1: At one time a woman was returning after having had a field sown.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.2: A lustful monk said to her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.4: She did not understand and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.5: “Yes, Venerable, but the furrow isn’t yet closed yet.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.8: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.7.1: At one time a monk saw a female wanderer coming in the opposite direction and, being lustful, he said to her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.7.2: “Sister, I hope the path has an end?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.7.3: She did not understand and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.8.1: At one time a lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.8.3: but you don’t give us what you give your husband.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.9.1: At one time a lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.9.3: yet you don’t give us the highest gift.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.1: At one time a woman was doing some work.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.2: A lustful monk said to her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.9: but there’s an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.10: The third rule, the training rule on indecent speech, is finished.
